oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-01-24 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 24, 1959. Featuring Ott Devine (announcer), Ray Price (host/performer), guest performers Wilma Lee & Stoney Cooper, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1007th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ray Price; Jordanaires; Wilma Lee & Stoney Cooper; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ott Devine introduces Ray Price -- Invitation To The Blues (Ray Price) -- Opening statement (Ott Devine, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces the Jordanaires -- In That Great Gettin' Up Morning (Jordanaires) -- Ray Price introduces Wilma Lee & Stoney Cooper -- Come Walk With Me (Wilma Lee & Stoney Cooper) -- Prince Albert commercial (Ott Devine, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Tommy Jackson -- Fisher's Hornpipe (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Ray Price talks -- In The Garden (Ray Price, Jordanaires) -- Ray Price introduces Chet Atkins -- Drifting And Dreaming (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Atkins, Chet; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Minnie Pearl; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Stoker, Gordon, 1924-2013; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Cooper, Wilma Lee, 1921-2011; Cooper, Stoney, 1918-1977
